chav1961.purelib.basic.interfaces

Interface ConsoleManagerInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConsoleCommandManager

    public interface ConsoleManagerInterface
extends java.io.Closeable

    This interface describes a console command manager. It parses command line, search appropriative command line processor and invokes appropriative method in it

    Every console command manager can get a command line from anywhere, parse it and call command line processors to process parsed command.

    Any class, marked with the @ConsoleCommandPrefix annotation, can be used as the command line processor. Some or every public methods of this class can be marked with the @ConsoleCommand annotation to associate the method with the given console command template (description of the templates available see @ConsoleCommand). To use class for command processing you need create the annotated class instance first, and then deploy it to the appropriative console command manager. An example of using annotations for the command line processor see console command manager implementation

    Any console command manager needs check matching the actual command line with the every known command templates of every command line processors had been deployed. If the command line matches some template, console command manager extracts variable parameters from the command line, converts them to the appropriative method parameters (according to @ConsoleCommandParameter annotation) and invoke the marked method with parameters extracted. Any marked method can return any data type, but two of them have a special processing in the console command manager:

    • String - returned string is printed to the console output as-is
    • boolean or Boolean - produces message "execution successful" or "execution failed" to the console output

    Any other returned types will be ignored.

    Any marked method can throws any exceptions when processing console command. All those exceptions will be incapsulated to the ConsoleCommandException exception. You can use getCause() method to extract source exception for the longer processing

    Any console command manager need be closed after the end of the console command line processing. After closing, no any actions can be made with the console command manager.

    Since:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    @ConsoleCommand, @ConsoleCommandPrefix, @ConsoleCommandParameter, ConsoleCommandManager

        close

    • Method Detail

      • deploy

        void deploy(java.lang.Object... ccp)

        Deploy command line processors to the console command manager

        Parameters:
        ccp - console command processors to deploy
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - any problems with the parameters
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - attempt to manipulate console command manager after close()

      • undeploy

        void undeploy(java.lang.Object... ccp)

        Undeploy command line processors from the console command manager

        Parameters:
        ccp - console command processors to undeploy
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - any problems with the parameters
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - attempt to manipulate console command manager after close()

      • undeployAll

        void undeployAll()

        Undeploy all command line processors from the console command manager. This method need be mandatory called from the close() method implementation

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - attempt to manipulate console command manager after close()

      • processCmd

        java.lang.String processCmd(java.lang.String cmd)
                     throws ConsoleCommandException

        Process command line

        Parameters:
        cmd - any command line to process
        Returns:
        string after command processing
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - any problems with the parameters
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - attempt to manipulate console command manager after close()
        ConsoleCommandException - any exceptions incapsulated from the invoked method of the command line processor. Use getCause() to get it.

      • processCmd

        void processCmd(java.io.Reader in,
                java.io.PrintStream out)
         throws java.io.IOException

        Make an infinite loop to the EOF of the input to process console commands

        Parameters:
        in - reader to red command lines
        out - console output to print processing results
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - any problems with the parameters
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - attempt to manipulate console command manager after close()
        java.io.IOException - any exceptions on the reader or writer.
